page.title: 12HANDICAPPED UNIT, THATCHAM.
page.content: The handicapped unit at Kennet Secondary school houses children from 12 to 18 years old. It was opened in September 1985 for pupils who are physically handicapped and currently houses fourteen pupils with a variety of disabilities. The unit is like a home at playtimes for the disabled pupils. Most do normal lessons but not games. The unit also has its own Headmaster along with a welfare assistant and a physiotherapist. She has her own room away from the unit in the sports hall complex. In the physiotherapy room the pupils spend up to 40 minutes having treatment. In that time they may try to balance on a ball, pedal an exercise bicycle and many other things to keep them fit. Although these boys and girls are disabled they are always happy and cheerful.
